Reviews.Title: “All perfect”
Reviews.Author: Philpoly
Reviews.Content: Centrally located in shopping area. It's the perfect solution for a short stay in Paris. Rooms are nicely decorated and confortable. Cummon are stilish and very pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “It was 3*** now 5****** but service still 3***”
Reviews.Author: Roman B
Reviews.Content: I was one night 21-22.02.2012 Design it's very nice. I order breakfast at 7-00 ok. But people start working 7-15. I order taxi for 7-15 of course it came at 7-30. Breakfast for 38 euro it's really nothing to eat . Brrrrrrrrrrr. Tin nightmare service. But design it's super! If you don't care for service welcome!

Reviews.Title: “Bertie at the Burgundy”
Reviews.Author: GPA7
Reviews.Content: Good: 1. Great rooms, stylish design,a very comfortable bed and a bed and bowls for Bertie (our dog). 2. Bulgari toiletries for Mrs G. 3. The Staff. Superb, Dubai-like 6star service, they even walked us to a restaurant a couple of evenings and got us a table when we were a little tired! 4. Lovely luxurious spa, although we only used the steam room and the pool. 5. Superb concierge. 6. Very good wi-fi in the room. 7. Excellent location. Bad: 1. We only used the restaurant (michelin star) for brekkie one day and it nearly bankrupted us. Perhaps we should've realised! It took a long time and it wasn't that amazing a brekkie considering the inflated price.

Reviews.Title: “5 star hotel centrally located, suited for families”
Reviews.Author: SofieZurich
Reviews.Content: We chose the Burgundy for a 4 day trip to Paris in Summer, mainly for its location (walking distance to Place Concorde with a toddler) and for its offering of a 2 room suite at a reasonable price (we were travelling with a toddler). Overall the stay was very pleasant. Our room faced the inner courtyard and was therefore very quiet. It was also furbished adequately and provided enough space for us three. The bed was a little bit on the soft side for our feeling. The staff was very helpful and most of time could provide for our wishes. Although the cleaning staff managed to turn up every day during the nap of our toddler despite promises to improve. The pool is rather small, but fitted our needs. A changing room and showering facilities in the area would improve the experience however. The continental breakfast was included in our rate and the offering was ok for a French hotel. We upgraded he breakfast every morning to a full breakfast because no dairies were included. We also appreciated the services for our toddler (free-of-charge buggy and bed provided) and will most certainly return to this hotel if the rates stay as reasonable as they were last summer.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic 5-star hotel in Paris”
Reviews.Author: cecpad
Reviews.Content: We went to Paris for the weekend and needed 3 rooms just for a Saturday night stay. Since I pay attention to reviews on TripAdvisor, I struggled trying to find hotels that didn't have mixed reviews. When I came upon Le Burgundy I decided to give it a try and I'm glad I did. One of us had the standard room with charming railings overlooking the street for 400 euros, and I had the Junior Suite for 630 euros. Both were large and comfortable by Paris standards. Everything was extremely clean and well maintained. The staff of the hotel was fantastic. They made us feel welcome, and took care of all our needs. I have no qualms recommending the Burgundy to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “New 5 stars hotel, romantic”
Reviews.Author: Lienalena
Reviews.Content: I get my deluxe room for 400 $ and is really worth it, excellent service nice swimming pool , sauna, hamam. Good location

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic boutique hotel with exceptional service, beautiful SPA and great restaurant”
Reviews.Author: nwlondon88
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay in February at this exceptional boutique hotel. Service is impeccable, so is the SPA and the restaurant who deserves its Michelin Star. Frontdesk staff is more than helpful!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel, exceptional staff!”
Reviews.Author: Travelhobbiests
Reviews.Content: I can't say enough great things about this hotel. Often times, high end hotels seem either too big to feel personally welcomed, too faux rich or too hipster trendy. This hotel was beautiful and unique in it's own. The interior design is subtle while unique, and the vision for the hotel felt consistent. Every staff member I spoke with was hospitable, kind and understood how important their roles were in providing us the best experience throughout our stay there. They were welcoming, respectful, displayed personal attention to detail. I even bought their scented candle to reminisce the wonderful experience I had in Paris, staying at le burgundy. Although pricey like most 5 stars, my experience felt well worth the price compared to the others. I hope to one day return in few years.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Parisian experience”
Reviews.Author: SimBrisbane
Reviews.Content: Le burgundy Hotel is in a really fantastic location, absolutely central to everything. We walked to all the sightseeing places with ease. The metro (subway) is less than 100m. The hotel is superb,exquiste and so luxurious. Like many rooms in Paris it is more expensive than we may be used to in Australia (400 Euro) but it offered the true experience of what I hoped my first trip to Paris would be. The hotel staff were helpful, friendly and welcoming. Just a glance in their direction and they were ready to assist with any query you may have. Did I mention how divine the rooms were....really beautiful and our looked at in to the central courtyard. It was very quite and one morining we slept through to 11am as the luxurious velvet curtains blocked out all light. The spa an swimming pool are sublime, hues of blue, lounges, towels and newspapers all on hand. If you want to experience Paris the way it should be seen, start by staying here. It will fulfill your Parisian dream.

Reviews.Title: “Overall, a good choice”
Reviews.Author: epilogue
Reviews.Content: We wanted to stay in a part of Paris we hadn't visited and chose the Burgundy because of the location, and because it seemed somewhat luxurious without being stuffy. Much of our experience was truly wonderful. The staff was very friendly and accommodating. We like hotels that have good common areas and this one's was nice--we spent a bit of time in the lounge, although if the music had been more consistent, it would have been far more inviting. A jazzy standard would be followed by something loud and raucous---odd. The bedrooms are comfortable and clean and well-furnished and fitted out; I don't think it's possible to find a room in France that doesn't have gorgeous curtains! What I didn't like: They have scented candles that overpower the common areas and manage to seep into the rooms. The first night, I really thought we were going to have to leave, because my husband is usually sensitive to perfumes. Fortunately, he didn't seem to notice, but honestly, that permeating scent would make me think twice before going back. The rooms either look out over the interior of the building (looking down on a glass roof) or Rue Duphot. We had two rooms, as our daughter was with us, so got to see both types. Rue Duphot, though a bit noisy in the mornings, was preferable, I thought, because the interior-facing rooms also face other rooms, so you pretty much have to keep your drapes closed. We ate in the restaurant our first night there, and the food and service were very good. The appetizers were surprisingly large, and could have made a meal. It was hard to finish everything. I never use hotel pools, but their small, dimly lit one was relaxing and charming and always empty: I used it twice.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Christmas at Le Burgundy.”
Reviews.Author: Kitdiva
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 5 days over the Christmas period and really enjoyed it. We were a little worried as we had previously stayed at another hotel in Paris repeatedly for Christmas and always loved it but it had simply become too expensive but as a result this place had a lot to live up to. First impressions were excellent. Helpful staff and nice lobby. The room I was in was beautifully decorated and comfortable and although the bathroom was a little small, it had all you need. My only complaint about the room was that the separate room for the toilet was so small the door hits you in the back when you walk in if you aren't careful. The spa was lovely as was the food and the service was friendly and helpful. In fact the were only two issues; first was that you have to spell out exactly what you want from room service including asking for butter to go with bread and sauces (mayo, ketchup, mustard) with burger, fries or sandwiches but really it wasn't the end of the world. The second issue was rather larger. On the last day my sister was dressed extremely casually for travelling and when struggling to get through the front door of the hotel rang the bell for help. She was let in and beaconed over to the desk where they gave her a mop and duster assuming she was a cleaner! She was mortified and they apologised but after 4 days they should have recognised her in such a small hotel or at least not have jumped to conclusions. Very embarrassing!! We all laughed about it but it was kind of awkward. Over all though a very good stay and we will probably go back next year minus my sisters outfit for the final day!

Reviews.Title: “Luxury boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: Caroline L
Reviews.Content: In some ways it is hard to write this review as I have never stayed in a 5 star hotel so have nothing to compare this to. This review is therefore useful for anyone who is thinking of booking something a bit special for a treat. It is worth noting that I have stayed in various hotels in Paris as it is my favourite city so visit almost once a year so can compare this to less expensive hotels. We looked at various 5 star hotels and this seemed to be the best value for the size of room on offer. We also prefer smaller hotels so this was ideal with just 59 rooms. We stayed in the classic room for 4 nights and it was perfectly comfortable and luxurious. Paris hotel rooms are small and this was definitely the largest room I have stayed in (with the added extra of a bath not just a shower) so you certainly do get what you pay for! The facilities in the hotel were great as the pool and spa offered a chance to relax at the end of the day. Having stayed in smaller, less luxurious for 2/3 nights I have to say that this place was ideal for a longer stay of 4 nights as it was a great place to unwind in at the end of a hectic day. The staff in all parts of the hotel were very polite and professional. We also ate in the restaurant on the first evening of out stay and the food and service were excellent. As it is 5 star (and Paris), all the added extras are expensive: breakfast, bar, minibar etc but you dont have to use these. The location of the hotel was great. I prefer Paris on foot but it was also handy for the Metro being just a few minutes walk from the Madeleine and Concorde stops. The only minor issue for us was that the windows could have blocked out a bit more noise from the street so unless you were in a deep sleep you could easily be disturbed by the dustbin wagon in the morning. Would I stay here again? Yes, for a treat. Would I recommend this hotel? Absolutely. Can I enjoy Paris for less money? Yes.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent little hotel”
Reviews.Author: Virtanen
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located excellently just 150 m from the metro stop of Madeleine and 200 m from Concorde. The shopping heaven of Rue de Saint-HonorÃ© is just around the corner. What can I say, the hotel was recently renovated and it shows. The staff was very friendy and spoke good English. The deluxe room was just what I wanted, though the official list price of 800 â‚¬ per night is a bit pricey. Luckily I got a better deal from the net site of my travel agent.

Reviews.Title: “meh”
Reviews.Author: gillyflower_dc
Reviews.Content: Sometimes when I read these glowing reviews I wonder if people have really had many experiences at luxury hotels. The staff kept asking if I needed anything, always ready to help--but I asked the concierge where to find a specific salon service in the city and he didn't know. Meh. There is free WIFI--but it was on the fritz all night. Meh. There is a fancy TV--with no entertainment channels in English. Meh. There is a spa with massages and a nice atmosphere (in theory)--and children splashing about in the pool that you can hear throughout the entire spa (including in the massage room where you're paying hundreds of euro to relax). Meh. The location is good--but my room faced the street and from 6-9AM all I heard where garbage trucks. Meh. There is a nice big bed--with rough sheets. Meh. You can get room service from a Michelin-star restaurant--but the food is just so-so and there are certainly no nice little extras (like say, a sauce!). Meh. Overall my experience was okay, but my "classique" room was certainly not spacious or anything to rave about...and although the staff was nice, I certainly could have gotten a nice staff for a much cheaper price elsewhere. Also...they are of course under no obligation, but I did mention to the concierge that it was the birthday of one of our party and that resulted in...nothing. I'm just saying...even just a little message or treat (not to mention a free upgrade!) would have been nice. But...nothing. Meh!

Reviews.Title: “Parisian chic”
Reviews.Author: ClassyLad
Reviews.Content: For a week last month my partner and I lapped up the outstanding service, beautiful contemporary decor, perfect concierge advice and explored the best Paris had to offer from this centrally located boutique hotel. Our spacious and quiet room was furnished with beautiful chic decor, had a big bathroom with lovely products and a mini bar stocked with luxury items (with Champs Elysees' prices!). This hotel gets big ticks for the no extra charges for wifi and complimentary Evian water provided each day. One of my pet hates though was the shower that leaked badly (why is this so common in five star hotels?). Concierge was our best friend. With Francois and Benjamin's outstanding help, our visit to Paris was made so much easier. They were happy to book restaurants for us even before we arrived. They managed to find us a table at one of the current 'hot' Paris restaurants - our friends were very envious - normally you need to book months in advance (we later found out that they had called the restaurant every day for us to see if there had been any last minute cancellations... we were lucky). The only minor (but frustrating) gripe I had was the confusion regarding the pricing for breakfast. It seemed so complicated. A basic continental breakfast (pastries and coffee) was included in our room rate, however when we decided to upgrade to the buffet the prices provided by staff were not consistent each day. The different costs were then reflected on our bill. We raised this when we checked out, which they sorted out promptly and without question. All-in-all, this is a very classy boutique hotel and we would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Probably the best Luxury Hotel in Paris right now. Perfect Honeymoon destination.”
Reviews.Author: Hebden2000
Reviews.Content: Was looking for a Luxury hotel in Paris for a reasonable price and was not disappointed. Impeccable service from all members of staff, very knowledgeable and helpful concierge. The bar and breakfast are expensive but this is to be expected. The pool really makes this place a gem and if I ever stay in Paris in the future then we will be sure to seek this place out again. Perfect for our Honeymoon. They were even able to get us into our room at 09:00 in the morning! Try Kiwi Collection for a better rate that includes a basic breakfast and automatic room upgrade (subject to availability) - worth obtaining a Visa Platinum card for!

Reviews.Title: “Love at first sight”
Reviews.Author: Jessica A
Reviews.Content: This is now hands down my favourite hotel in Paris. It's small enough to feel intimate, very well located, wonderfully decorated, and the staff are the perfect mix of attentive and friendly. We had a lovely suite which was clean, spacious, and had great decor and a wonderful bathroom. While we didn't use the spa and pool facilities, we did take a peek around and they are gorgeous. The concierge was ever patient with my constantly changing requests and the management was quick to reverse a charge that we disputed. This really is an excellent hotel and we plan to return every time we travel to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel... did not want to leave”
Reviews.Author: casamoir
Reviews.Content: Everything was perfect about this hotel and I can be picky. Can't think of anything that wasn't just wonderful. I was only there for a night and didn't want to leave. The location is perfect - in the heart of Place Vendome and the amazing shopping district. The staff are just amazing, professional and super friendly and they mean it. The room was beautiful. I didn't have a chance to try the restaurant which is highly acclaimed and a Michelin star I believe, but will do so next time. It's located on a quiet street so while in the heart of Paris and the night life is happening all around, you get a calm quiet feeling inside the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “This is a fine boutique five star hotel in the best area of Paris.”
Reviews.Author: whalemush
Reviews.Content: We chose the Burgundy from Tripadvisor as it appeared to be in an ideal location and five star. Q We looked at other hotels but we prefer smaller boutique hotels.It is within walking distance of all the major attractions in the next street to Chanel and off the Rue Honore. Staff were exceptionally polite and helpful especially the Concierge Sebastien who arranged so much of our visit.We ate out at various restaurants in Rue Duphot and the nearby streets . We were surprised that the Burgundy did not have a higher rating in Tripadvisor.Perhaps reviewers seek hotel chains?We would certainly recommend the hotel to five star travellers

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful rooms but expensive”
Reviews.Author: Leer
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 2 nights at the end of my month long apartment stay in Paris - as a special treat. Perhaps I had been spoilt in the spacious apartment but it felt a bit claustrophobic. My room was also 304 which is in the travellers photos. Pretty but not much natural light. Location is excellent. After paying 2 Euros for coffees in the Marais (sometimes less) - paying 6 Euros here was a bit steep. Also breakfast at 32 Euros is excessive. I did have an amazing dinner in the restaurant. I just think 400 Euros for a small nice room is too much but that's Paris, I suppose. I just didn't love it.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Le Burgundy!!!”
Reviews.Author: eliselaf
Reviews.Content: This was our first stay at Le Burgundy, and our Deluxe Room was superb! My husband loves the Meurice, but I wanted to find a smaller and more intimate hotel on this trip. Now he wants to stay only at Le Burgundy! We loved everything about this hotel, which is expensive, but worth every euro- our quiet, spacious, beautifully decorated room, utterly comfortable bed, blackout drapes, lovely marble bath with separate bath and rain shower, fabulous maid service, complimentary water, petit fours on arrival and Maison du Chocolat candies at turndown, gorgeous heated pool, friendly and efficient concierge service, and fantastic one star restaurant (Le Baudelaire- do not miss it!). Every moment we spent here over our four night stay was a pure pleasure, and the location is wonderful- steps from the Rue du Rivoli, St Honore, and the Madeleine. We didn't try the spa, but the pool was heavenly after hiking around a very warm Paris each day. Nor did we try the breakfast, not with Angelina five minutes away! Not only would we give this hotel our most enthusiastic endorsement to anyone who would listen, we also can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Absolute perfection on all levels”
Reviews.Author: t-montreal
Reviews.Content: I took my mother to Paris for 5 nights and though I have travelled all over the world and stayed regularly in 5-star hotels, I can honestly say that Le Burgundy has outdone its competition. What makes this hotel so incredible, other than the luxurious surroundings and convenient location, is its impeccable staff. Really. Unsurpassed graciousness and service. I thought I'd died and gone to heaven. And the food at the restaurant was - by far - the most delicious we had anywhere in Paris. My mother and I were treated like royalty by every single staff member - it was as if we were the only ones there. Our waiter at breakfast remembered exactly what we preferred and how - after only one night. The doormen were an example of what every hotel should aspire to. Nightly piano playing meant that a late afternoon drink at the bar was the perfect end to endless walking through the streets of Paris. Great female jazz player. The room was huge. My mother and I shared the king-size bed and it was really like having your own bed. The toiletries were great, the lighting was good and the little nightly chocolates were a decadent treat. The only design flaw was in the placement of the mirrors - none was close enough to a plug, making it a bit of a gamble when styling my hair. Also, the only full-length mirror was on the inside of the closet door that didn't open all the way. Having said that, it was quite funny to have to check out my clothes by side-stepping into the closet - good for a laugh - but perhaps someone else might have been incredibly annoyed by this. If I sound incredibly effusive, it's only because service of this quality is a rare gem. From the concierge to the waiters to the bus boys and housekeepers - this is a hotel that deserves every ounce of praise it gets. GO! don't even hesitate.

Reviews.Title: “Super Chic, fabulous restaurant”
Reviews.Author: makoh3
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed our quick stay at the Burgundy. Service was prompt and accepted. Room was modern, "spacious" (for Paris) and had a warm feel. Nice toiletries and soaps in a lovely bathroom were very appreciated. The One michelin star restaurant is outstanding. Nice location and boutique chic feel.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful in every way! Beautiful hotel in a great location with excellent customer service!”
Reviews.Author: CarKri02
Reviews.Content: A truly delightful stay! From the minute we arrived at the Burgundy, it became obvious why this hotel is a rising star in the Paris Hotel scene. We were travelling to France for a work conference with another couple - they are well-seasoned 5-star world travellers, and they were also truly delighted with this hotel! It was our first trip overseas without the kids so we decided to splash out and book a junior suite. The usual rack rate is a pricey 1200Euro per night, however, everything in Paris commands a premium price and I think this hotel certainly delivers a quality service that you would pay more for elsewhere. The hotel is newly refurbished and the decor is luxurious and elegant, yet extremely comfortable. The staff are extremely attentive and very welcoming, and clearly take pride in their hotel and want to ensure you have a faultless stay. Our suite had a small entry area with large built-in robe space, minibar & safe, and a separate WC; small sitting area with two comfy chairs & reading lamps, desk & large flatscreen TV; a bedroom with king size bed, flatscreen TV, iphone docking stations; separate bathroom with large comfy bath, separate shower and a toilet. The small touches were lovely - petit-fours on arrival, plush velour slippers, daily complementary bottled water, lit makeup mirror, dimming light switches, aromatherapy toiletries, plush window furnishings with sheer or blockout options, daily weather forecast card in the turndown service. The bed was super comfy (I am a huge fan of the Westin Hotel trademark Heavenly beds, but this topped that!!) - I don't think I have ever slept better in a hotel bed, and I have tried many! The rooms are extremely private and quiet, with complementary and efficient wi-fi service for multiple devices. My only disappointment was that there were no tea & coffee making facilities in the room (which I did expect to find in a suite), however, on talking to colleagues staying in other hotels in Paris & France this appears to be a common finding, and there always seems to be an open cafe on every corner - even the small train station kiosks in Paris make a good coffee! I always look at the hotel floorplan on the fire escape instructions to compare room size, and it appears that the suites are probably only slightly larger than the deluxe rooms, however they do have a small separate sitting area and additional toilet/powder room. For future stays, I would happily consider staying in a room as a less expensive option as I believe their level & style of furnishing is similar, and the extra space in your hotel room is not crucial when you spend all your time exploring this wonderful city! The location of this hotel is fabulous. It sits on a pretty and quiet street between two major boutique shopping strips (rue St Honore & Madeleine) in a lovely upmarket part of Paris. It is a short walk from two underground train station lines (Concorde & Madeleine), and reasonable walking distance (with comfy shoes) to several major tourist sites such as the Louvre, Arc de triomphe & Champs Elysee. We easily walked in our dress shoes for a lunch at the Ritz Hotel. The train provides easy access to the places which are too far to walk to: Eiffel Tower took 5 minutes by train, and the Chateau Versailles (which sits on the outskirts of Paris) was a pleasant 45 minute journey. Although we didn't manage it in our short stay, I noted that it would have been walking distance to the Musee D'Orsay & Opera, and easy train to the Latin Quarter & Notre Dame. We dined in their restaurant Le Baudelaire - definitely worthy of its recently acquired Michelin 1-star rating - lovely food, great dining experience, reasonably priced and excellent service. Unfortunately we never managed to try their pool or day spa due to lack of time, but I hear they too are excellent. In summary, we were absolutely delighted and suitably impressed by this boutique hotel. We are already planning a return visit to Paris and will definitely be staying at the Burgundy again!

Reviews.Title: “Elegant, personal hotel with wonderful staff”
Reviews.Author: SunburyTraveller
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed in a Classic room (304) for three nights. The hotel staff were enthusiastic and so polite, helpling make our stay in Paris wonderful. The rooms are beautifully decorated and have everything you could need, ours had a nice view down onto Rue Dupholt. We loved the spa area, this was very quiet and relaxing. The location couldn't be better, back just a few streets from the action meant it was very quiet but you could easily walk to many great sights. Hotel Le Burgundy was fabulous and great value by Parisian standards.

Reviews.Title: “Boutique 5 Star Luxury + Location without the 5 Star Price of Paris”
Reviews.Author: Mike_ATL100
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for a week while she was attending a conference in Paris. We wanted a 5 star luxury hotel in a central Paris location without the 5 star price of the Four Seasons, Park Hyatt or Ritz. This newly renovated, small property on a quiet street between Saint Honore and Madeline was a perfect fit for our needs. If you are a looking for a see and be seen place or a large lobby environment to watch people come and go, this isn't the place for you (although the bartender named off several A list stars who recently stayed here to avoid the public scene). However, if you like the idea of new, large rooms tastefully decorated in a classic modern style with quiet but attentive service, then definitely take a serious look. The hotel upgraded us to a deluxe room from a classic room at no charge, which overlooked one of the interior gardens. There were a total of maybe 8 or 10 rooms on our floor, and the hotel is only 6 floors, so expect a great night sleep without much disturbance. A couple of things we liked about the room was the little book nook where we could place our own books, magazines and tourist maps. I know it seems small, but it was very useful. The wardrobe was also large and had plenty of room for all of our clothes and shoes, and we brought a lot for a week. The free bottles of Evian water (replenshed throughout the day) was also a nice touch. The air condition system also worked very well and kept the room to our perfect temperature without any noise. The concierge team was EXCELLENT; one of the best I have ever worked with. They were timely with our many advance emails regarding restaurant reservations and kept up with the reservations throughout our stay and even ordered taxis for us so that we were ready to go at the designated times each evening. Most of the restaurants we picked ourselves using Zagat and TripAdvisor together, so I cannot comment so much on this aspect of their work (my reviews are in Trip Advisor). Finally, and nothing to do with the hotel itself, there is a gourmet grocery with single serve meals, drinks, sundries, and wine! right around the corner on boulevard Madeleine which was a great amenity and was better than any hotel shop could ever be (its called Monop). The hotel's restaurant was reliable for breakfast and overlooked a quiet courtyard; we had the continental breakfast built into our room rate and paid 8 euros more for the small but good quality buffet (the buffet otherwise would be 38 euros a person, which is not worth it). I will try to review the hotel's 1 star restaurant for dinner separately on Trip Advisor (La Baudelaire), which at the time of this review wasn't rated yet. I read a negative comment about the lobby fragrance being overpowering; true, but they burn one of their signature candles throughout the day. I think the idea is good, but agree that if one is sensitive to such smells, you might not like it and I would recommend a redo on the candle scent to something less overpowering. The only real negative/complaint is their bar off the lobby which they have fashioned as the only hotel lobby cognac bar in the City. Nothing about this bar works for this hotel. The design is way too dark and impersonal -- during the day, I don't see myself reading a book and enjoying a glass of wine as one could at the Four Seasons or Hotel de Crillon bars. The bar isn't even a bar that you can sit at. And, at 900 and 1200 euros a glass! for many of the cognacs they display, I am not sure I understand the connection to their guests, most of whom I suspect do not even drink cognac, much less at that price. But, having said that, my wife and I did enjoy a late night cocktail in front of the fireplace (we were the only ones in there), so it at least serves a purpose. One block away is the Hemmingway Bar at the Ritz (use the back entrance) which I would recommend highly over this one. Bottom line: We would definitely stay at Le Burgundy Hotel on our next trip.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional service and a great nights sleep”
Reviews.Author: DrLawBath
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel. As soon as your cab arrives outside the hotel you are taken care of. Great staff, a nice touch to be given a little tour of the facilities before going to the room. Given wifi code on check in. Room beautiful, such attention to detail and really comfortable. You will have a wonderful nights sleep on the comfortable bed. Immaculately clean. Imaginative contents in the minibar. Great location, very near the metro and major attractions. One of the negatives was that there was no mirror in the bedroom, only in the bathroom. This made it very difficult for me to style my hair as hairdryer, straighteners just about stretch from a socket in the bedroom to the entrance of the bathroom but then you have to stand up to blowdry your hair which is not great. Beware the breakfast, at 38 euros is very expensive for a buffet breakfast, I would go elsewhere. Another nice touch is being given a little bag of chocolates at check out "something for the road" which is nice. Great service, would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: greynomad16
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 nights in a junior suite - twin beds plus an extra bed in the lounge. The room was large by European standards and had an extra toilet and washbasin which was handy. Upon arrivng late at night we ate in the restaurant - it was very expensive. Being Australian the wagyu beef sounded good - we were told that it was not cooked so promptly chose something else - at least we were told. The hotel is in a great location and has only recently reopened after a huge makeover. There are plenty of places to eat around the area. We paid for continental breakfast which was only tea/coffee/juice, pastries/bread and spreads at Eur 30 - expensive. Cereals, fruit cheese, meats etc was an extra Eur 8. I guess everything in Paris is expensive. There is a gym in the hotel which was adequate, but had a leak in the ceiling - water dripping from the kitchen above. We organised transport from the airport which worked well. The hotel was very clean and I would stay agian due to the location but would eat out for all meals. We picked this hotel on the recommendation from trip advisor and the location.

Reviews.Title: “Stunning hotel”
Reviews.Author: js0754
Reviews.Content: Splashed out on a junior suite for my girlfriends birthday, well worth it. Location is brilliant, right in the middle of a beautiful part of Paris. Take a visit to the pastry shop on the road to the left outside the front door, sooo good. Room was emaculate, and beautifully designed. Hotel staff so friendly and helped us loads. Spa was quiet and very relaxing. Definitely the place to go to treat someone.

Reviews.Title: “OK ,needs some adjustments”
Reviews.Author: JenTal
Reviews.Content: Hotel fabulously decorated. Especially Rooms. Beds and Pillows extremely comfortable, Very good housekeeping, room spotless each day. Good air con. Rooms very adequate size. I always in summer ask for sheets and blanket, no duvet. This was a struggle for them to understand. They placed the blanket in the duvet cover. It worked! On arrival I had an altercation with desk staff regarding an error in my original quote for 2 rooms. I had originally been quoted a family rate for 2 rooms, he persisted in arguing with me with a smile on his face. This was not settled until the reservation manager promptly appeared ( I requested his involvement) and honored my quote. This could have been avoided. Thankyou Slyvain Obviously we were paying a hefty amount and I did not want to have to pay one more Euro. We paid over a thousand US dollars a night for the 2 rooms. We were taken to the 2 rooms. There was an over whelming smell in the first room (410) obviously coming through the air conditioning, my daughters stayed in room 409 it seemed to be fine however occasionally they said they smelt that smell again. I refused the second room (410) and after 20 mins we were taken to another room (401), which was great! Now we are home, I am washing my daughters clothes the clothes smell of the candles burning in the hotel foyer even though there was no candles on our floor or in the rooms. So I have to question why there are so many candles burning in the foyer? For our inconvenience of changing rooms we were sent a beautiful plate of fruits and 2 glasses of champagne. This was much appreciated. Concierge was excellant with organizing a rental car and also restaurant help. I do agree that the Parisian way is well and truly present in this hotel, staff smiling however not friendly. There was no warmth, no one seemed happy. We did have a wonderful 4 days in Paris and were very comfortable in this hotel, however i do have my reservations about some of the details of this hotel. The swimming pool is in the basement as part of the spa and was not one where you would choose to relax in after a day of sight seeing, the basement was lit by mood lighting, rather odd actually. The location is excellent and is easy walking distance to most of the wonderful historic sights with the metro station very close. The surrounding restaurants were very expensive for a family of 4 so we really headed to other areas to eat. I did so much research and honestly I think this is truly a difficult city to find that good all round hotel for a reasonable price and I am talking approx $500-$600 a night in the summer. If you find one please let me know. We had come from London, Knightsbridge The Berkeley costing under $1000 for 2 amazing rooms with full breakfast included. NOT one thing we could fault in our 6 day stay. I do believe very comparable locations and cities.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: lidi A
Reviews.Content: Excellent stay.Close to everything we wanted to visit! The staff very polite, friendly,willing to help us in whatever we asked for (e.g.suggest restaurants since it was a weird season, we found most of the restaurants closed for vacation).Fine beds, quilts, bed mattresses and amenities.Very clean.The decoration just beautiful.It was all we needed for our stay in Paris. Beautiful, clean, with polite staff.There only problem we faced was the advance payment we had sent and couldn't be crosschecked because August 15th was a bank holiday. We will definetly go back! Its the best place to stay, when in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service, Great Location and Nice Room for Paris Standards”
Reviews.Author: James A
Reviews.Content: This is a great location a short walk from great shopping and the metro. What was remarkable was the service. We happen to walk by with bag one afternoon on our way to another shop and the valet recognized us and asked to take our bags to our room. We left very early to the airport and there were employees there and yes we got home at 5 a.m. sometimes and there were employee's there to help out. The bedding was great and the size and decor of the room was great. Definitely would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: davidweller
Reviews.Content: I would highly recommend this hotel. My wife and I spent 6 nights at the hotel celebrating our 20th wedding anniversary. Our first experience showed the excellent level of service. When I got out of the cab in front of the hotel, the taxi driver accidentally forgot to give me my credit card back. When I went to check in, I quickly realized I forgot to get my card back. The front desk called the cab company (i had my credit card receipt) and in three minutes, the doorman brought me my card. The staff's English was excellent which helped us quite a bit. We found the Concierges all very helpful in making suggestions and getting us dinner reservations. As we were walking out one morning to sightsee, the weather was threatening rain and the doorman handed me an umbrella to use for the day. I even emailed the concierge (who gave me his card as we left) after we got home and he was able to get us the French Onion soup recipe from one the restaurants we had eaten in. Our room was very nice with an extremely comfortable king size bed. The restaurant was very expensive $70 Euros for a continental breakfast is a little over the top. As other reviewers have mentioned, the location is terrific. All in all, I would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing”
Reviews.Author: mersedeh1970
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel. We had booked two rooms and requested for a connecting. Even though they were booked, they changed our rooms to connecting on the 2nd day which was great. It's a great location with great rooms and bathrooms. Our kids loved the pool. This is a great 5 star property. The only thing we didn't love was the breakfast (the continental breakfast was overpriced and nothing to it). Loved the hotel and the location.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Hotel in the Perfect Location with Perfect Staff”
Reviews.Author: beento45countries
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the utterly delightful Le Burgundy in a spacious junior suite for eight nights. Our three children ranging in age from 9 to 13 stayed in a nearby junior suite with two double beds and a cot (or perhaps they were in one grade higher - I can't remember). Le Burgundy is a beautiful gem of a boutique hotel set in a fabulous location just off Rue St.-HonorÃ©, and its elegant continuation, the Rue du Faubourg St.-HonorÃ©, two blocks away from Place de La Concorde, and also within walking distance of the Tuileries Gardens, the Louvre, and the lower end of the Avenue des Champs-Ã‰lysÃ©es, and the Left Bank. While I "hear" the comments of a few other reviewers about its prices, we felt that, for our junior suites, it offered a very good value for its price, given its staff's dedication to customer satisfaction, its ambience, junior suite room sizes, location, and its beautiful, relaxing pool (with water jets and a mini-waterfall spout!) near its spa - our kids couldn't WAIT to go to the pool at the end of each day!! Le Burgundy has all the benefits of a large "name" hotel such as the Ritz, Le Crillon, or the George V. coupled with the friendliness and concern of a boutique. Its ever-helpful, gracious, and unpretentious staff constantly impressed us with their dedication to our daily satisfaction - they were wonderfully attentive folks who spared no effort to ensure that our children would enjoy their first trip to Paris immensely. It was also quite nice that every employee, from top to bottom, knew our names from the instant that we arrived; they were always one step ahead of us, whether it was reminding us to take some of the hotel's umbrellas to checking with us about our dinner reservations for that night. From their responding promptly and courteously to our multiple itinerary-related email inquiries before we had even arrived to their providing us with numerous restaurant recommendations and arranging a wonderful guided private tour of Versailles, nothing, and I mean nothing, was ever too much trouble for their concierges, Sebastien and Francois. One would be unlikely to get that kind of continuous, courteous personal attention from the concierges at the other hotels I've mentioned above. As I wrote above, it is ideally located - we were able to walk to most nearby attractions such as the Louvre, Notre Dame, Musee d'Orssay, the Pompidou Centre, Petit Palace, l'Arc de Triomphe, and shopping along the St.-HonorÃ©/Rue du Faubourg St.-HonorÃ© (but we are "walkers" - others might feel Notre Dame and the Pompidou are a little too far away to walk). Our rooms and the public areas, too, are tastefully decorated in an attractive and bright Euro/Art Deco-type manner which appealed to my wife for their design excellence and comfort. The rooms and their furnishings were modern, very clean. and well-air-conditioned. The bath and shower were very nice sizes and our beds were also very comfortable, which is especially important to us since I'm 6 feet 1 inch tall and my wife has back problems. We do agree with another reviewer's criticism of the hair dryer outlet's unusually inconvenient location (in one of the hall closets in our room) but .... Paris city electrical code is the code - I guess they don't want people electrocuting themselves in the WC. Speaking of our hall closets - while there are no chest of drawers for our clothes in the junior suites (which was a little surprising), there was sufficient space to stack all of our informal clothes on the shelves above my dress shirts, sports jackets, and my wife's dresses that we hung in our hall closets (plus there were several small pull-out drawers in that same closet area for my socks and our other accessories). Given that we stayed for 8 nights, there was obviously sufficient storage space in those areas. We respectfully disagree, however, with another reviewer's criticism about the hotel's fragrance - while ever-present in all public areas of each floor above reception, it is not present in the private guest rooms nor is it cloying or unpleasant - in fact, we liked it so much that we thought about buying one of the hotel's candles that have the same scent to bring it home as a pleasant reminder of our Paris vacation. I can't even imagine that this hotel would ever be anything less than 100% focused on ensuring that each guest has an ideal stay. We, too, highly recommend it for anyone traveling to Paris. Although my wife and I have been to the "City of Light" many times before, we would now never stay anywhere else and look forward to "coming home" to le Burgundy on our next trip!

Reviews.Title: “Average”
Reviews.Author: CAWItravellers
Reviews.Content: My Fiance and I stay in many different hotels from small eclectic ones to five star chain and boutique hotels. This is supposed to be a five star hotel but I think is lacking in certain areas. The interior of the hotel was very nice and the amenities were great. The staff while professional did not seem especially friendly, it was kind of cold and stand offish. The room service menu was pretty paltry and again the service was cold. From the time room service took our order to delivery they did not say much, they did not ask if everything was okay. The person who delivered room service set down the tray asked me to sign the check and then walked out without asking or saying much of anything. While the rooms are nicely appointed and it is in a good location for the price of the hotel there are other better options out there.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding service and great location”
Reviews.Author: Rrapt
Reviews.Content: Nothing is overlooked in their attempts to provide the very best service. All of the staff very attentive, remembered your names, even when casually meeting them out and about in Paris, away from the hotel. The porter got off the elevator mid stream to allow me on without a wait. Dining room 1 star (Michelin), with again excellent service and food and reasonably priced. Breakfast however was a little overpriced for a family of 4. Would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Didn't want to leave! Lovely hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: DerbyBob
Reviews.Content: I was slightly sceptical when my centurion card recommended this new boutique hotel, as Whenever we travel we expect the best and I hadn't heard of this hotel, but we were not disappointed at le burgundy. From the moment our chauffeur dropped us off, the attention to detail began. The check in staff were efficient, kind and helpful. Our room was well appointed with sumptuous fabrics and luxurious bed linens. The hotel location is fantastic for shopping or sight seeing and the concierge team were always on hand and ready to help. The best restaurant at the hotel was splendid and I thoroughly enjoyed my meal on the last night, in fact it was the nicest meal I'd had in a long time, a gourmet sensation with an element of fun. This boutique hotel is in my opinion the best 5 star in Paris!

Reviews.Title: “You get what you paid for. Equalweight.”
Reviews.Author: Asparagusman
Reviews.Content: Positives: 1) Location, location, location. Fabulous location within walking distance of most of Paris' famous sites and just off the beautiful shopping avenue of Rue St. Honore. 2) Concierge was excellent. They catered to our needs swiftly and offered excellent advice. Negatives: 1) The overpowering smell. It hits you like a mallet to the forehead as soon as you walk into the hotel. I'm sure this is designed for the relaxing ambience of the hotel but really not necessary and is actually quite sickening. 2) For a 5 star hotel the room is a bit cramped. The lobby and the general infrastructure of the hotel is quite small so not exactly a "luxury" hotel although it has all the modcons. Summary: For a 5-star hotel not outstanding nor great value for the money but location is fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: exobscurislux
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights both for business (my husband) and me (pleasure). This hotel is an elegant, clean, boutique hotel with an amazing location. Steps to the Seine, Louvre, metro, Galleries Lafayette and Opera. WiFi in room. Fabulous decor. Very attentive staff. Very quiet - easy to get a good night's sleep. Excellent AC, bathroom, etc. We paid a hefty price for a junior suite. Overall, a wonderful hotel, but for the price and for being a 5 star, I expect perfection and it did have a few downsides. We arrived in the morning from an early flight and (as is often the case) our room was not ready. We chose to wait in the spa area, but they didn't have any lounge chairs to lay down, just simple chairs. It would be nice to have a more comfortable place for jet lagged guests to wait for rooms. There is no hair dryer outlet in the bathroom - they want you to plug the hair dryer into an outlet in the closet behind your clothes and use the closet mirror to blow dry your hair! Claimed that this is due to a "rule" that there should be no hair dryers in the bathroom. I ended up using the hair dryer at the desk in the room. They disturbed me to clean the room when I had the "do not disturb" light illuminated and I could not get an explanation as to why this happened. Front desk was very apologetic. You are provided one bottle of water per day in the room - extra bottle is $10. I hate to be "nickled and dimed" at an expensive hotel - but I will admit that is my personal beef! Yes, I know that I am being picky, but a 5 star at this price should be perfect. Nonetheless, a fabulous hotel and I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel in Paris”
Reviews.Author: Bacibosco
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at all the top hotels in Paris. Le Burgundy is the best of the best. Service, courtesy, immaculate rooms, and the single greatest concierge in the hotel business. Like others, I wish I had stayed longer.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: Katy018
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for only one night but the service was amazing and the hotel was lovely. We didn't make use of all of the facilities but the spa looked lovely. The hotel has a perfume throughout that seems overpowering when you first walk in but actually adds something special. We got engaged whist we were staying at the hotel and the hotel sent up complementary champagne and strawberries to our room which was a lovely touch. The rooms are a decent size in comparison to other hotels in Paris. I would definitely stay again...in fact it was hard to leave!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel, if cost is no consideration”
Reviews.Author: KBBrighton
Reviews.Content: Le Burgundy exudes quality and luxury and is very well appointed. A wonderful blend of aromatherapy scents greets you as you walk into the lobby (through the doors always held open by the lovely doormen). All of the staff are excellent and helpful. It is an oasis of calm, and the spa and pool are lovely (we had the pool to ourselves everyday for the 3 nights we spent here). It is well designed and planned so that you can wear a robe and take the lift straight from your floor to the spa area without having to wander around half-dressed, Our deluxe room was smaller than we had hoped, especially as the cost per night is pretty high (it was our honeymoon, so we wanted to push the boat out!). However, the details in the room, such as the lovely linen and toiletries, as well as the rain shower, were great. The location is excellent - 3 mins walk from Madeleine metro station, and 3 minutes walk from the banks of the Seine and Les Tuileries, and 10 minutes walk from Les Galeries Lafayette department store. Watch out for the high cost of extras such as breakfast (30 Euros per person), anything from the mini-bar, and watching pay-per-view films in your room! We had a lovely relaxing stay, but felt it was a little overpriced. If money is no consideration, then a great choice of hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel in the heart of Paris”
Reviews.Author: DebJanP
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Burgundy for the May bank holiday weekend, and absolutely loved it. A gem of a hotel, lovely room, sink-into bed to die for, lovely dinner in the courtyard. Wish we'd stayed a day or so longer to sample the Spa and swimming pool - both looked soooo inviting. A short walk from the Louvre. Not cheap, but never for a moment felt taken for a ride. Great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “The French Key”
Reviews.Author: ZakKifisia
Reviews.Content: Burgundy is a very cute boutique hotel, situated in a fantastic location right across of Rue Saint Honore. All the major shops and malls are in a walking distance, as are some of the most important sights. Champs Elysee is no longer than 20 minutes walk. Our room inside was very well decorated, modern style and very clean. I asked for a room where my girlfriend could smoke and they offered us a room with a great terrace. The service overall was perfect, from the doormen who remembered our name to the concierge who suggested some great restaurants and bars and made all the necessary reservations. All the members of the staff were at least friendly and eager to please. I didn't use the pool and the spa although they looked great. The only complaint I have is that our TV had a problem on the second day and was not fixed and that the cleaning lady did not clean the ashtrays. Overall a great boutique hotel that I would definitely visit again when in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Jewel Box”
Reviews.Author: naomihecht
Reviews.Content: Fantastic service, exquisite pool, sauna, steam, extraordinary location. Come loaded.

Reviews.Title: “business turned vacation”
Reviews.Author: DrBBest
Reviews.Content: I arrived desheveled confused if you will with all the meetings and medical chit chat yet somehow as i entered the spa here it all melted away. i decided to stay extended aswell i also took the liberty of becoming a regular at the spa. i have a new found appreciation for the magic of prevention of illness rather than treating symptoms, a few hrs in a spa a month/week can prevent a lifetime of discomfort. what gracious staff.

Reviews.Title: “great”
Reviews.Author: doudacairo
Reviews.Content: that was my second stay there what rely counts apparte from the location the staff thery are rely nice and helpful always there for you. the hotel itself very well decorated with nice scant allover being an added touch.

Reviews.Title: “All 5-star hotels should be like this !!”
Reviews.Author: BacchusHK
Reviews.Content: This is a relatively new hotel right in the middle of shopping district. When we were researching for a hotel, my fiancÃ©e fell in love with the pictures. I am happy to report that this boutique hotel is as comfortable as they appear to be. Room is nicely decorated, very warm and rich. Location is excellent as it is near the main shopping district. The housekeeping staff and front desk staff was friendly and helpful. I did not know Paris well and the front desk staff was attentive to all our queries. Overall, an excellent stay. I cannot remember the last time I was completely satisfied with a hotel!! Also, if you like great seafood and a great duck confit, go to Flottes just a short walk from the hotel !

Reviews.Title: “Splendide!”
Reviews.Author: seasatin
Reviews.Content: Lovely boutique hotel just off Rue Saint-HonorÃ©. Staff was very friendly and the concierge helpful, booked for us the best restaurants and even got a table for us when a resto was fully booked! Spacious, clean rooms, every time we went out we came back to the room and bed made up. Expensive breakfast at 44.00 â‚¬ per person though! We will definitely go back and recommend this to our friends.

Reviews.Title: “Paris in the Spring - perfect”
Reviews.Author: gle3120
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a two night stay at the Burgundy having enjoyed every second - flights were on time, weather was fantastic and the hotel was perfect. We received a warm welcome on arrival and were shown the hotel's facilities before being escorted to our room - a classic room on the first floor (room 107) which was a beautiful, well appointed room with the bonus of a private outdoor terrace which was a lovely serene area to relax in after a hard day sightseeing. The bathroom had a large shower rather than a bath which was fine for a short stay. The room was immaculate - in fact when we returned after going out for breakfast we found one of the desk staff escorting a painter making good a small mark on the inner door. Nice to see this level of attention to detail. The staff were all very charming and attentive whether on the door, front desk, in the bar or restaurant and nothing seemed too much trouble. The hotel is very well located - close to the Madeleine metro station and l'open bus tour stop (less than 5 mins walk), It is also close to many local cafes and restaurants and plenty of shops including the really high end designer shops. We ate breakfast out of the hotel as I preferred to eat at one of the nearby pavement cafes and watch the world go by. We did eat in the hotel restaurant one evening, it has been awarded its first michelin star - well deserved the food was excellent and my pea soup truly memorable. We also ate at a nearby Flottes - in the first floor restaurant not the ground floor brasserie - not as good as the hotel but lovely none the less and worth a visit. Overall the hotel really made our short stay - contemporary but not at the expense of comfort and a real refuge from the bustle of the city - having researched Paris hotels extensively on trip advisor this hotel ticked all the boxes for me both when viewing online and in reality - highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely”
Reviews.Author: JandPsAdventures
Reviews.Content: We came to Paris for a romantic weekend. Le Burgundy was chosen largely based on TA recommendations. The hotel is lovely. We were personally escorted to our Deluxe Room. A large room by european standards with all expected 5 star amenities. In addition to the expected, I appreciated the breath mints and the daily complimentary bottle of water. The toilet is completely seperate from the bath (which I love). Also a seperate shower and tub. PS-there is only one outlet in this room suitable for an electric razor. Bed was as comfortable as our own. Larger than usual TV is a plus. We had a lovely dinner one evening in the hotel restaurant. Food was first class, delicious with excellent presentation. Location proved to be exactly what we wanted, convenient and close to everything including the underground trains and tour bus stop. Downside is the staff member that escorted us to the room explained that the outlet for the blow dryer was located in the CLOSET! Fortunetly, it had a long enough cord, so I unplugged the floor lamp and used the blow dryer in the toilet room. This worked out fine--my husband had the total bathroom to himself while I dried my hair! . Also the view in the Deluxe Room was terrible (maybe the necessary sacrifice for the perfect quiet). We were out of our room before 9am, returning just after 3pm, but our room wasn't clean. We spent ~45 minutes in the bar waiting for housekeeping to finish. Not a big deal, but noteworthy. Lastly, the WiFi signal was too weak to maintain an internet connection (also not a big deal for a romantic get-a-way, but important for business). I will stay again, and hopefully get a chance to use the beautiful pool!!

Reviews.Title: “A place to get engaged...”
Reviews.Author: CyrusA
Reviews.Content: Clean, comfortable, serene ambiance in a bustling heart of Paris. The bed was one of the most comfortable I have ever enjoyed. Our only complaint was that the silverware at dinner did not work with the plates and continually fell off the plates into our lap! Amusing until it was annoying. Same with the dark shower in the spa: a few extra lights would make it less dangerous. Otherwise, it was a delightful place to make a decision to become engaged. I loved the pool so much that I was late for dinner. My partner, not knowing where I was felt anxious enough that he decided on the spot that we needed to marry. We went ring-shopping the next day and plan to return sometime soon to pick up the ring. I think Le Burgundy will be our home away from home again. Thank you!

Reviews.Title: “Short break in Paris - stay here”
Reviews.Author: LuxuryLuvva
Reviews.Content: Two nights in Paris, bracketing a Disney day. Excellent location for sightseeing, walking or metro. We had a classic room and a junior suite. Only difference was size. Quality was consistently excellent. Staff were helpful and welcoming but not intrusive. Free wi-fi made searching for information hassle free.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding!”
Reviews.Author: footloose91
Reviews.Content: This hotel is highly recommended. The standard of service is exceptional and the staff extremely helpful and professional with none of the Parisian surliness one can sometimes find. The rooms are beautifully appointed, and the bed was fantastic. We ate lunch in the restaurant and it was extremely good food, and in the evening we had a drink at the bar was atmospheric, with lots of candles and a pianist playing in the lobby. The hotel has a lovely ambience. Without doubt the best hotel I've stayed in in Paris and certainly one of the best I've ever stayed in. I'd love to stay there permanently!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely lovely hotel and a great location”
Reviews.Author: NicoleM_07
Reviews.Content: We were expecting a lot from this hotel for the price and we weren't disappointed. The room was lovely, a little small but we only had the classic room, which is the smallest on offer. The staff were very friendly and obliging, giving us help in planning our trips each day about the city. The location of the hotel is great being only half a block from the Madelaine metro (a main underground station) as well as within easy walking distance of the Place de la Concorde, the Louvre and some pretty darn good shopping! Lots of restaurants and cafes around as well - I recommend Laduree for breakfast or lunch and anything in between!! The hotel's own in-house restaurant is simply amazing - do yourself a favour and book in for at least one night. We ate there twice during our stay and were impressed both times. Paris is a most beautiful city and this is a stay we will remember for a long time.

Reviews.Title: “An Amazing Hotel”
Reviews.Author: GroundCover
Reviews.Content: -Impecable, friendly service, -clean, beautiful rooms, -unbelievably helpful concierge and staff. -Incredible location -the most comfortable bed I have slept in There is nothing they could have done better and nothing I would change. A truly beautiful paris experience.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic experience”
Reviews.Author: hookem55711
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at Le Burgundy for 5 days this November. The location is perfect, rooms are a great size and staff is amazing. I agree that the breakfast is steep but should not be a deterrent as there are many cafes nearby. We had an amazing experience!

Reviews.Title: “A haven of peace and luxury.”
Reviews.Author: eagletraveller
Reviews.Content: Having reviewed countless hotels in Paris, I chose the newly re-opened Burgundy for a four-night stay with a friend. It was truly beautiful - elegant designer decor; the most comfortable beds in history; lovely staff; and brilliant location. Highy recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent alternative for those looking for a 5-star hotel”
Reviews.Author: rgenotti
Reviews.Content: We took a complete gamble and booked Le Burgundy for a few days because our other hotel did not have space for the entire trip. We did not want to leave. The location cannot be beat. It is central to everything most tourists want to see. The renovation is very well done, so says my partner who is a very picky interior designer. The public spaces are beautiful. The spa is amazing. The pool is one of the prettiest I have seen in Paris. We had it to ourselves the entire time we were there. The bar is beautiful. We spent every evening there. The cognac list cannot be beat. The bartender became our best friend. The entire staff was very accommodating and friendly. They put up with my poor command of French and resisted the temptation to switch to English (much appreciated). The concierge is very helpful. The halls of each floor and the rooms are padded and covered in silk, which makes for a very quiet (and luxurious) stay. Our room was beautiful, not overly large although we had the Deluxe category, but nicely appointed and spotlessly clean. We had a separate rain shower and tub. The bed was amazingly comfortable. The only minus was our restaurant experience. The dinner was good but not great. They brought my partner the wrong entree (there were two fish dishes). He did not discover it until the end of the meal (as he didn't like or eat most of it). The waiter was very apologetic, and it was an honest mistake, but he did not remove it from the bill (he bought us dessert instead). We found that a bit strange. Otherwise, our stay was perfect. I highly recommend this as an elegant alternative to the other 5-star "palace" hotels. We will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent ....”
Reviews.Author: LMc070
Reviews.Content: My husband & I have just spent four days here and had an amazing time... service was excellent... location, room & attention to detail, impeccably. The Spa although still being finished was the perfect end to a days shopping.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden GEM of a lifetime....do not miss out!”
Reviews.Author: NYC21401
Reviews.Content: WOW! This was recommended by my American Express concierge. This hotel underwent a 3 yr renovation and re-opened this summer as a 5-star hotel. I was thoroughly impressed. The location was perfect - around the corner from Rue Cambon (Chanel, anyone?), around another corner from Place Vendome and Rue Honoree (more shopping), yet a short walk to Rue de Rivoli (Louvre) and Champs Elysee. The best part is that it is not in a "tourist-y" or crowded area and you can find great little shops and restaurants on the block. The staff was amazing. I wish I could have them wherever I travel in the future! The rooms are beautiful - and DO NOT miss out on the pool and spa. The concierge recommended dinner at Vin Chai Moi, when we asked for a "local" restaurant with delicious food, not a fancy overpriced tourist trap. He not only escorted us to the restaurant personally, but introduced us to the owner, who seated us immediately and made recommendations for the most delicious wine and dinner we could ask for. We wanted a modern, new Parisian hotel, with friendly staff and great location - and we got it! Thanks Hotel Le Burgundy, for a wonderful stay!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good but watch out for expensive breakfast and unmade bed.”
Reviews.Author: JulesCT
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have just spent 3 nights at Le Burgubdy hotel in Paris. The location is outstanding and the hotel is beautiful. Lovely clean modern look and warm welcome. The trouble is that all I wanted for breakfast the next day was something small so ordered the warm flavoured porridge which was displayed on the menu as a seperate item. They didn't have it available and suggested we have the cereal. We were initially charged for the full breakfast menu (34 euros) and after we complained were then charged for a continental breakfast. We tried to explain that it was listed seperately but unfortunately the staff were not interested in our story. The next day we found our room was not made up by 3pm in the afternoon. After we told them to make it up when we left the hotel only to find at 7h30pm when we arrived back the room was still not made up!!!. For a 5 star hotel which we paid 440 euros a night for, this is not acceptable. I found the female staff to be rude and unfriendly. Has potential, but felt we were cheated.

HotelInfo.Name: Burgundy Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: 6/8 Rue Duphot | 1st Arr., 75001 Paris, France
